attributes.action: Armed Forces Federation(AFF). An independent voice of the Armed Forces
attributes.background: Armed Forces personnel are unable to strike or have a Union. While we understand the need for the military to be able to conduct it's role without striking, the military also require a body to hold the MOD accountable for issues such as lack of kit, decent food, accommodation & pay to name a few.
attributes.additional_details:
I hereby ask the govt to look into starting an AFF whereby it is headed up with a mix of both ex Officers and Soldiers to put forward the case for current servicing personnel.
Fill Your Boots has become a social media hub for personnel to talk about a mix of issues from jokes and banter to kit gripes and poor accommodation.
I would also ask the Government to look into having Alfie Usher (ex 3 Para) as the first consultant in this AFF.

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=222702931238392

attributes.action: Allow pharmacists to have basic prescribing rights for minor illnesses
attributes.background: Pharmacists already play a vital role in the local community. On the continent pharmacists play an active role by prescribing antibiotics for minor illnesses and providing emergency prescriptions. In England we face increasing pressures on A&E and GP primary care we ask the UK government to discuss
attributes.additional_details:
There is growing evidence that commissioning pharmacists to undertake basic prescribing duties will ease significant NHS challenges. such as :
- A & E pressures
- GP pressures 

In Spain and Portugal ( amongst other counties ) pharmacists provide a walk-in service where they will consult and issue prescriptions for more minor illnesses, and yet, in the UK we under estimate the resource we have available. 
www.pharmacymagazine.co.uk/let-us-prescribe-to-help-the-nhs

attributes.action: Make pancreatitis known as a disability
attributes.background: Pancreatitis which is inflammation of the pancreatitis is an incurable disease. It causes widespread pain. It also affects the digestive system. Sufferers are on strong pain relieve to manage the pain. Symptoms of the drug include nausea, insomnia and generally feeling unwell.

attributes.action: Butt Out -Make cigarette manufacturers change cigarette filters to neon pink
attributes.background: Cigarette butts litter streets, beaches containing carcinogenic chemicals that leach out.Discarded without a second thought. The current flesh colour hasn't changed in many years, blending in not standing out. If  more obviously visible it would deter people from smoking and casually dumping butts.
attributes.additional_details: Dangerous for wildlife as well as us. Billions are dumped analysis worldwide. Groups suggest placing further smoking bans but if they were more visible i feel it would help people to notice what they leave behind.

attributes.action: Help people with disabilities get the same chances and opportunities as everyone
attributes.background: In schools they need more facilities for the disabled as they cannot access the classrooms where their lessons take place, changes need to be made so that they do not have to worry about not being able to reach their lesson. Also, mental health needs to be made more aware of to students/teachers.

attributes.action: To create a compulsory road safety test for UK cyclists.
attributes.background: To decrease accidents and increase safe riding on UK roads I would like a road safety test to be introduced so that all cyclists understand the rules of the road including all signs, signals and markers and guidance of how to correctly ride a bicycle on a road.
attributes.additional_details:
-In 2014 there were a total of 21,287 cycling casualties of which 113 were killed.
-Common Cycling Accidents
Motorist emerging into path of cyclist
Motorist turning across path of cyclist
Cyclist riding into the path of a motor vehicle, often riding off a pavement
Cyclist and motorist going straight ahead
Cyclist turning right from a major road and from a minor road

attributes.action: Allow transgender people to self-define their legal gender
attributes.background: Transgender people in the UK are forced to pay to prove their identity to a Gender Recognition Panel. This process is humiliating, outdated and unnecessary. We urge the government to introduce an act equivalent to the Irish Gender Recognition Act, and allow trans* people to self-define their gender.
attributes.additional_details:
Having your gender recognised by the Gender Recognition Panel requires trans* people to go to pointless expense - whether requiring them to pay administration fees (and having to go through the lengthy and underfunded NHS gender transition system) or paying to attend a private clinic to receive the required evidence as well as paying to be seen by the panel.

Furthermore: no provisions are made for non-binary gender identities.

attributes.action: Free driving lessons for people on jobcentre plus benefits 17 to 24 to get a job
attributes.background: In order for more young pleople to get jobs we need to be able to drive. And with this opportunity it will help more young people to get a job and build a better future

attributes.action: Make tax fair - apportion multinational profit to UK based purely on salary bill
attributes.background: Multinationals minimize tax by arbitrarily moving profit to low tax countries. The law must be simplified to stop this. One way is to apportion profits to a country based on relative salary costs. That way companies pay more tax for a bigger workforce. Google would then have to pay their fair share.
attributes.additional_details: I run a technology company with offices in the US and UK. Due to the nature of technology, it's not easy to define the relative contribution each part of the company makes to profit. It's not surprising that HMRC finds it difficult to do this with multinationals and their opaque profit-passing structures. Salary bills are the most clearly defined cost, and tie in with a sense of fairness based on headcount. Agreement between US and EU authorities would be needed. Tax must be seen to be fair!

attributes.action: Make employers pay tax on fuel used travelling to work to encourage home working
attributes.background: A significant proportion of commuters in the UK are travelling to desk based jobs where they operate a computer and a telephone. The road networks are buckling under the strain and the environment is suffering. By shifting the tax on fuel to employers, they are more likely to prefer home working.
attributes.additional_details:
Many UK companies have an old fashioned approach to home working where they think the employee may not be working etc so don't allow or restrict this flexibility.
Meanwhile, workers spend hours sitting in cars, wasting time, fuel, money, blocking up the roads and pumping emissions out.
If an employee is allowed to claim the tax back for the fuel used driving to work, the company can recommend home working to save money which is better all round.
The government should make this policy mandatory.

attributes.action: Provide research and funding into the use of DRACO's to #EndTheVirus
attributes.background: Research into the use of DRACO's against a variety of Viral diseases has already proved successful in the lab. Eliminating all traces of multiple Viral strains tested both in-vitro and animal studies! However, Dr Todd Rider has failed thus far to secure enough funds to perform additional research!
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.niaid.nih.gov/topics/BiodefenseRelated/Biodefense/Pages/DRACO.aspx

http://www.techinsider.io/can-todd-rider-cure-viruses-with-draco-research-2016-1

attributes.action: Make dental care free for all pensioners that have paid into a UK pension.
attributes.background: I don't not think that pensioners who have spent most of their life paying into their pension, should have to pay for dental care. They have worked extremely hard for that money and they have to pay extortionate amounts for things they should be getting for free.
attributes.additional_details: Under 18's get dental care for free because they don't earn money. Pensioners also no longer earn money. The only money they have will eventually run out so why shouldn't they do what they like instead of what they have to?

attributes.action: Reduce the number of unnecessary traffic lights and speed cameras
attributes.background:
The number of unnecessary traffic lights and speed cameras has increased significantly which has resulted in slower journey times and an increase in traffic.

Attached research: http://www.iea.org.uk/in-the-media/press-release/rip-out-80-of-traffic-lights-to-boost-economy-road-safety

attributes.action: Make vaping bans illegal and regulate vaping fluid ingredients.
attributes.background:
Vaping is much safer than smoking, and causes no unpleasant odour. If the ridiculous bans on vaping of many establishments was made illegal, many more smokers would make the switch.

Many vaping "pre-mix" fluids contain needless toxic ingredients for "a smoother vape" and should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is for the good of public health.

If vaping indoors was a legal right, more people would invest in electronic cigarettes out of convenience alone. More people would make the switch and save the NHS millions in the long term, while nicotine tax would continue to provide government revenue.

Poor quality vaping fluids are the reason why people think vaping is unsafe. Pre-mix vaping fluids need only contain nicotine, base and flavour, as is already available but it should be the law.

attributes.action: Always oppose Taiwan independence
attributes.background: As we all know, since ancient times, Taiwan is an inalienable territory of China, but recently the Taiwan leadership election, some twiwaness who advocate taiwan indenpemdence insult in facebook .They does not respect history, feel free to reverse history.

attributes.action: allow the uk citizens to directly elect a prime minister
attributes.background: . currently no prime minister is directly elected and this situation does not bring justice to the people of Britain no game should be played of I got more part time mps than you elected so a direct appointment. this is wrong this is not democracy.
attributes.additional_details: the prime minister must be directly elected by the citizens of Britain if this individual is any good at all for the job then the mps in his party will be obviously elected. at present there are too many regions across Britain voting merely based on tradition for a party irrespective of actual candidate. however when it comes to the leader of Britain the best person for that job should be elected as voted for by the citizens of Britain.

attributes.action: Remove families right to veto organ donation when the deceased is an organ donor
attributes.background:
Since 2010, 547 families have blocked their recently deceased relatives organs being given to those who desperately need them, even though their relative was on the organ donor register.

Please change the law so relatives can not block organ donations from those on the organ donor register.

attributes.action: Keep the National anthem for the United Kingdom.." God save our queen "
attributes.background:
MPs are expected to vote later on the idea of England adopting an official national anthem.
God Save the Queen, the national anthem for the UK as a whole, is currently used for England during most sporting events.
attributes.additional_details: Why should we change our National anthem after decades.? I think we should be proud to preserve our heritage.!  Please share and sign this with everyone..

attributes.action: Force energy suppliers to reduce prices for consumers in line with the oil price
attributes.background: When utility fuel prices go up so does the consumer costs but when they come down there is a huge disparity between the costs. Especially with the low oil and gas prices there should be a far greater fall in consumer prices and kept in line the rises and falls in real terms.
attributes.additional_details: Much documented utility rises linked to oil and gas prices yet reductions are less than expectations.

attributes.action: Make it legal to pass details on to police officer not member of the public.
attributes.background: Stop people from leaving the scene of an accident without passing on their details to a police officer. It is currently LEGAL for someone involved in an accident to pass their details on to a witness or passerby without waiting for a police officer to attend.

attributes.action: Reform council tax for empty properties
attributes.background: Empty properties are now charged 100% council tax despite non use of local facilities. There isn't even an allowance for non person discount rather than single person discount. This penilases (again) landlords that are between tenants or are forced to sell.
attributes.additional_details: I have had to pay 2 lots of council tax on several occasions. One single person discount in the property that I live in here I use all council services and 1 at 100% charge where it has been between tenants and no facilities at all have been used. This investment is my only pension as I am a sole trader and I am again being penalised.

attributes.action: This 0.7% of GDP is approx.12 billion pounds a year should be repealed.
attributes.background:
Charity begins at home.
Look after those who pay tax at home and not the rest of the world.
Cameron you are so out of touch
attributes.additional_details: Cameron get real

attributes.action: Ban the use of "committed suicide" by public bodies or in any official context.
attributes.background: My Grandfather ended his own life 11 years ago, for reasons we will never know. My Grandmother never recovered from both finding him after he had passed, but more so the stigma attached to the way in which he died. Suicide isn't a crime, and the term 'committed' should cease to be used in reference.
attributes.additional_details: There was a similar petition to this which recently gained over 2000 signatures, but this has since become inactive due to it being on here for more than six months and failing to obtain 10,000 signatures. I am doing several charity events to raise money for the SOBS charity who help those left behind following death by suicide, and I would like to reignite this petition, gaining enough signatures for this issue to be seen and considered in parliament.

attributes.action: Give the 28% of people who did not vote in the UK EU referendum a chance to vote
attributes.background: In the referendum only 72% of people voted for what to happen to the country, we believe that these people who might not have understood the circumstances should have the right to vote now. We are not asking for another referendum but for a continuation of the previous vote, for the 28% undecided.
attributes.additional_details: The votes should be added on to the original totals and interpreted in the decision of whether to leave or stay in the European Union for the sake of the people of the United kingdom. We think this because the more information has been released after the original vote had taken place, and this information could alter the opinions of the undecided UK residents.

attributes.action: A Judicial Review on the exclusion of 16 to 18 year olds from the EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Scottish Referendum allowed 16 to 18 year olds to vote but the EU Referendum, which impacts the young disproportionately, did not. This decision was seemingly  based on cost considerations not on the legal precedence that has been set.

attributes.action: Referendum on the Danish option for UK devolved regions to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Danemark but not in the EU.

We request that the regions that voted RemaIN, should  remain part of the EU, and the regions that voted leave, to be outside the EU, without breaking up the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We hereby call on the elected representatives of all the areas that voted RemaIN to negotiate with the EU to enable our clearly expressed wishes to remain EU citizens, and to press the UK government to explore all possible options in our relationship with the EU.

We request that the UK government hold a new referendum on all realistic possible options for the relationship between the UK and the EU, before the UK government starts the formal process for the UK to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Keep the United Kingdom inside the European Economic Area (EEA) and rejoin EFTA.
attributes.background:
-A supermajority of young people voted to remain inside the European Union
-We now know the consequences truly of voting to leave and Article 50 hasn't yet been triggered.
-Hundreds of thousands if not millions of Leave voters regret their decision
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned pledge our support for the United Kingdom remaining a part of the EEA, which includes the EU alongside Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. We pledge our support for rejoining the European Free Trade Agreement, which we established in 1960 and led until 1973. EEA member countries outside the EU participate in its single market but can also negotiate trade agreements freely and independently. We the British people would also continue to have de facto European Union citizenship.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to hold a second BREXIT referendum until 2036.
attributes.background: A referendum has already been held, and democracy is not about taking a second vote if you aren't happy with the first.

attributes.action: Delay submission of intent to leave the EU (Article 50) until there is a new PM
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum to leave the EU & the subsequent resignation of the PM it would not be in the UK's best interests to rush the submission of our intention to leave until a new leadership is in place.  This must be delayed until at least October to maximise the two year period.
attributes.additional_details: There are reports of EU leaders and other member states wanting the UK to submit the intention to leave immediately and begin the two year notice / negotiation period.  Given the likely duration of a leadership contest and the current target of October 2016 this could result in a rushed process and damage the chances of getting the best possible exit for the UK.  This petition is to delay the submission until a new PM and cabinet are in place so they are able to negotiate without distraction.

attributes.action: All political parties to have equal say in negotiating terms of exit from the EU
attributes.background: The future of Britain after the Referendum is the single most important issue facing us today. Our prosperity, security and well-being, as well as that of the rest of Europe and beyond is too big a responsibility for one group of politicians and cannot be left solely to the current government.
attributes.additional_details: We are told that exit negotiations could take up to two years. Mr Cameron says it should be left until his successor is appointed after October 2016. This could mean that the earliest date for implementation would be October 2018; only 15 months before the next general election which may provide a change of government. Therefore the crucial first years after implementation should involve all parties.

attributes.action: Not to invoke Article 50 until the year 2026.
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU because a political party used the promise of an in out referendum on our European membership as an electoral bribe was both ethically and morally wrong. 
For this, and many other reasons, I feel that a prolonged period of reflection is needed before Article 50 is invoked.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to hold a UK Election within a year of any change of PM
attributes.background: New PM'S should have a mandate from the people they govern, rather than a few party members.  As such a new UK GENERAL Election should be held within 1 year of a new PM being appointed so he or she can claim to lead the People as PM with a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age in referendums to 15 and elections to 16.
attributes.background: After the EU referendum I felt powerless to say my opinion because I am too young to vote. However many people at my school have a very large knowledge and definitely would've voted if they had the chance too. The people that these referendums impact the most aren't allowed to put forward their say.

attributes.action: Debate the legality of denying EU migrants the vote in the EU Ref.
attributes.background: Denying EU migrants, on the electoral roll, the right to vote in the EU referendum contravenes EU law (enshrined in the TFEU, Part 2) on non-discrimination based on nationality.
attributes.additional_details: The outcome of the EU referendum has an impact on the lives of non-British nationals resident in the UK. It will also impact on the lives of their families and children. Consequently they should have the right to vote.

attributes.action: Abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as UK voted for democracy.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as they are unelected and a barrier to having a full democracy in the UK. This is something that has proven to be a public priority with it helping to secure a leave vote in the recent EU referendum.

attributes.action: The Government to ensure EU funding is replaced on a like-for-like basis.
attributes.background:
A large number of projects across a wide field of endeavor, including such diverse things as scientific research and urban regeneration, are currently funded by the EU. As the UK disengages itself from the EU this funding will be withdrawn.
This could lead to many vital projects being abandoned.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for workers in dog shelters to kill unwanted dogs.
attributes.background: In dog shelters, workers kill unwanted dogs after a certain amount of time, which can be up to a week which doesn't give the dog a chance to live in a happy home where it is wanted. Dogs have feelings too, dogs are a man's best friend!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dogwatchuk.com/death-row-dogs/
attributes.creator_name: Fiona Grezda, Jasmine Murphy, Alma Roe

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to tell lies in Parliament, or to the Public.
attributes.background: It is totally unfair that MP's can consider that their jobs allows them to be dishonest with both Parliament, and the General Public, with no consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at how many MP's have been accused of lying in the Euro Debate.  How are the Public meant to know what to vote for, when all they are hearing are called lies!

attributes.action: Make it an illegal offence for women to smoke/drink/use drugs whilst pregnant.
attributes.background: People know the risks of tobacco, alcohol and drugs, we all know the risks and dangers we're exposed to, we wouldn't dream of giving these to children, never mind newborn babies. So why do so many women continue to use these whilst pregnant? They are knowingly harming their unborn child.
attributes.additional_details:
Just like smoking and drinking, drugs have a major effect on a baby, the least of which is giving birth to a baby who is addicted to the drug. The consequences of using cocaine, for example, include heart attack, respiratory failure, strokes, and seizures, and all these life-threatening health problems can also be passed to an unborn baby.

All these products increase the risk of miscarriage, low birth weight, health complications and risks later in life, including mental health problems.

attributes.action: Enforce stricter banking regulations for online gambling transactions.
attributes.background: Many online gaming companies offer a self-exclusion service as part of responsible gambling. However, due to the large variety of online gambling sites, it is very easy for problem gamblers to relapse. We want banks to offer a similar self-exclusion service for such transactions being made.
attributes.additional_details: Our suggestions are for a self-exclusion based service being made available by banks to offer a more rigid deterrent to online gambling addicts from which is currently available. We'd also like to see stricter regulations in normal online transactions being made to gambling sites; and question marks being made where large sums are being deposited to help deter online gambling and aid those with addictions or potential addictions to gaming.

attributes.action: Hand the same Â£100 on the spot fine to cyclists without a helmet.
attributes.background: Motorists are given an on the spot fine for not wearing a seatbelt.  There is no reason this should not be imposed upon a cyclist on a cycle without head protection.
attributes.additional_details: There are already many changes in cyclists favour. Prioritised junctions, Left turn bans, Stricter lgv regulations, mirrors at junctions, but still day after day they dart around without safety equipment. More responsibility should be put on them.

attributes.action: A law that restricts roadworks to 5 miles in any 30 mile stretch on a motorway.
attributes.background: Over the past few years there has been significant investment in upgrading our motorway system, this has resulted in many miles of roadworks with restricted road width and an imposed fifty mile an hour speed limited that is monitored. Some roadworks go on for 15 miles plus.
attributes.additional_details: Extended roadworks (greater than 5 miles, Incl lead-in/out) with reduced lanes and a 50 Mile an hour speed limit requires significant levels of concentration. It increases the likelihood of an accident, increases traffic jams, restricts movement, increases the time it takes to get from A to B when the roadworks are for extended miles. Drivers get more frustrated, more likely to speed. When there is a 15 mile stretch of roadworks, on large stretches nobody is working anyway!

attributes.action: Make it law for all bedsheets sold in the UK to be labelled with their size
attributes.background: It's very difficult to guess the difference between the different sizes of sheets sold in Britain. Thousands of wasted person-hours a year could be saved if all sheets were properly labelled so we didn't have to make at least three trips to the airing cupboard every time we wanted to change a bed.

attributes.action: Keep university bursaries for student nurses
attributes.background: The U.K. Government is planning to scrap maintenance grants and bursaries that many trainee nurses rely on to get through their valued education.  In place of the grants and bursaries, the government plan to change them into student loans.
attributes.additional_details:
Newly qualified nurses that do an extremely valuable job, are starting their careers with huge training debts which accrue interest, will be paying for their whole careers.

This is a disgraceful treatment of the future generations of NHS staff and should be scrapped.

attributes.action: Change the law on the dangerous dog act 1991 Stop putting healthy dogs down.
attributes.background: Innocent dogs and puppies are being put to sleep for no reason, just purely for the type of breed. Why? If they have done no harm and have proven to be safe in public they have the right to live! its inhumane and cruel! why should the dog pay for the irresponsible backyard breeders and owners!
attributes.additional_details: The dangerous dog act 1991 has been created to stop and ban four breed of dog including the Pit Bull Terrier. These dogs are known for dog fighting and built and bred for the large muscular physique. Why should we put these dogs down if they have done nothing wrong? Any breed of dog is capable of killing or causing harm to humans! dogs are not born dangerous, its in the hands of the owner who we should blame! lets change this. backyard breeders and irresponsible owners should be prosecuted.

attributes.action: Charge us more national insurance and properly fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is now running at a huge defecit. This can be easily solved. Charge us more national insurance - double it if you like. Use that money to properly/sustainably fund the NHS for a growing, ageing population. We'd much rather fund a public system for all than pay for private health insurance.

attributes.action: Send all foreign prisoners back to their countries of origin and ban them.
attributes.background: We have seen on recent BBC news programmes that the UK prison service is in a dire straight. Lack of funding, violent and dangerous it is another failing part of the UK.  Foreign criminals, many from the EU now make up a significant part of the UK inmates and are costing us a fortune.

attributes.action: Make a commitment to create a British space elevator (not just a space port).
attributes.background: If we truly want to get in to the space race we need to make a bold move. A space elevator would allow for cheap transport into orbit. The material science is close. We have a possible site in the Ascension Islands and we should take the initiative for once. The commercial possibilities are endless
attributes.additional_details:
Space Elevators in Science Fiction, also see Beanstalks

http://www.extremetech.com/extreme/176625-60000-miles-up-geostationary-space-elevator-could-be-built-by-2035-says-new-study

BBC, Wikipedia

attributes.action: Parliament to debate: "It's wrong for UK to remain in democratic deficient EU."
attributes.background: Given that the UK has a centuries long tradition of democratic checks and balances and the EU has severe and structural democratic deficiencies it would be wrong for the UK to remain in the EU as to remain in the EU reduces the democratic means of accountability to the British People:
attributes.additional_details:
The key severe democratic deficiencies of the EU are as follows:

The EU has Four Presidents and NON are Elected
The EU Parliament CANNOT start new or get rid of existing EU Laws nor allow for Private Members or Private Bills
The EU Government (the EU Commission) is NOT Elected is not accountable to us & we CANNOT remove/change it
The EU does not form law in PUBLIC and does not enable people to take part in forming it or accountable public debate on EU law
The EU IS  DEMOCRATICALLY DEFICIENT

attributes.action: It is Now time to Abolish Abortions, 200,000 foetus murdered in the UK in 2015.
attributes.background: Since the Abortions were first legalised in 1967, approximately 22,000 abortions were carried out. This figure has increased over and beyond expectations. Time to Stop Abortions Now
